In southwestern Ontario, due to deteriorating conditions and multiple collisions, Highway 401 was shut down between London and Tilbury, near Chatham, on December 23. Additionally, a 50-vehicle pileup caused the closure of Highway 402 between London and Sarnia.

Lionel Messi, an Argentine footballer, posted photos on Instagram of him winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup. It became Instagram's most-liked post ever, with over 56 million likes, surpassing the record held by the Instagram egg.

In 2021 the EU imported most of its natural gas, but following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, gas imports from them have decreased. This is because of the rising cost, cuts in supply, reduction in consumption, and a wish to no longer be dependent on Gazprom for resources.

Elon Musk did not want people to know about the flights on his private jet, so he blocked the Twitter accounts that shared this information. However, by doing this, he actually drew more attention to the issue.
Wednesday Addams's dance from the series and its fan recreations to Lady Gaga's song "Bloody Mary" became popular on TikTok after its release.

In a 233-191 vote that crossed party lines, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill to give Puerto Rico its first binding referendum. This referendum will determine if the unincorporated territory should become a state, an independent nation, or an independent nation with a special relationship.
The U.S. Senate approved a defense bill that cancels the requirement for military personnel to get vaccines.
The Royal College of Nursing launched the biggest strike in NHS history, arguing with the government over a pay rise for nurses.
Sam Bankman-Fried, a former CEO of FTX, was arrested in the Bahamas. The U.S. government asked for his arrest, but the charges are unknown.

Japan's internal affairs ministry announced that last month the country experienced its most significant level of inflation since 1981. Core consumer prices had increased by 3.7 percent compared to November 2021.

Charles Sobhraj, a French serial killer, was released from prison because of his advanced age and good behavior. This release was ordered by the Supreme Court, as Sobhraj had been serving a life sentence for murdering two tourists in Nepal in 1975.
The Indonesian government set the volcanic alert status to the highest level due to the eruption of Semeru in East Java, which caused the evacuation of roughly 2,000 people.
Fourteen people died and 24 were hurt when a drunk driver crashed into a parade in Calabar, Nigeria.
The Supreme Court of the United States voted 5–4 to keep Title 42 of the U.S. Code, which allows the government to remove people who were recently in a country with an infectious disease.
The Taiwanese government said they would make conscription last for one year instead of four months. They explained this was due to the higher risk of China attacking to take over Taiwan.
The National Health Commission announced that, starting on January 8, China will no longer require people entering the country to be quarantined due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Three Irrawaddy dolphins, a critically endangered species, have died in Cambodia within 10 days of each other, causing serious concern.

Aleksey Chadov began writing the script in February 2019. This followed events in Yekaterinburg, which honored Aleksei Balabanov and the movie War (2002 film). War was the film that propelled Chadov's career almost twenty years ago.
A winter storm brought record-breaking low temperatures to North America and left more than 80 people dead.
Hlynur used his three children to help him film Nest outside his house over 18 months.

Southwest Airlines uses point-to-point operations rather than the hub-and-spoke system used by other U.S. airlines. They had a "meltdown" of crew scheduling which caused a lot of flight cancellations, even after the worst weather had passed and other airlines had recovered.

In 2022, protests were held in Peru. Supporters of the ousted president, Pedro Castillo, organized them. People from the left and far left sides of the political spectrum felt they were politically ignored and discriminated against.
The film is about a woman struggling and performing superstitious rituals to have a male child, after her first child is a girl.

The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines closed the country's airspace for six hours because of an electrical outage at their air traffic management center. This caused 282 commercial flights to be delayed and 56,000 passengers were impacted.

In 1791, Young's first poetry book, named Genius and Fancy, was released and became successful. It was described as "a survey of the London stage" and was followed by an even larger second edition with triple the number of pages as the original.

Fungi in Art is important for its role in preserving artworks from fungal decay and contamination. It also supports dialogues between mycologists, artists, and society through initiatives like the 'Massee Art Grant' by the British Mycological Society and other projects supported by the Fungi Foundation.
Pope Francis, Benedict's successor, notified people of a decline in his health on 28 December. Subsequently, the news of his death was reported and the faithful were asked to pray.

Thomas Mathew was born on September 27, 1940 in Keekozhur, Kerala, India. He studied at Christian College, Chengannur and Maharaja's College, Ernakulam and began his career by teaching at Christian College, Chengannur.
Stephany announced she would stay as the Minority Leader of the Vermont House while running for mayor and said she would assign her daily duties to Paul N. Poirier, the Assistant Minority Leader.
The impeachment was a major event during that time. It was a struggle between the two major U.S. political parties about, for example, the role of Federal courts.

LaSalle's appointment was disagreed with by the progressive members of the New York Senate. They spoke out against LaSalle because of how he handled cases involving abortion and labor, which they considered too conservative.

In 2022, Phillips Academy correctly forecasted all senate races polled before Election Day, such as Catherine Cortez Masto's win in Nevada. However, it overestimated the Republican party in the races for the Arizona governor and Georgia senate runoff.
Barnes was born in Detroit, Michigan on April 27, 1944. His alcoholic parents mistreated him regularly. He said his mother had tried to cause a miscarriage by taking drugs.

The DC Native History Project was created to collaborate with indigenous people from the area and to bring awareness to the Anacostan culture of the region. They are also making an interactive map of Washington, D.C. that shows the original village sites and places where artifacts were discovered.
During the 1941 and 1942 Philippines campaign, the US Navy lost their naval base in the Philippines and Hawai'i became their primary base for the Pacific War against Japan.

Eliot moved to Washington, D.C. in 1933. His job was to direct the National Capital Park and Planning Commission and develop the National Mall. He worked in this role until 1943 when he switched to the National Resources Planning Board, which was part of the Public Works Administration.

The Great Mosque of Kairouan was a very important Aghlabid monument. It was reconstructed in 836 by emir Ziyadat Allah I, but further repairs and modifications were done in later years. This makes it difficult to know the exact timeline of its construction.

Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, a Slovenian point guard, scored the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association. He had 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists, helping his team to a 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.

LaBelle was taught how to use the 8mm and 16mm camera props with real film inside them, for the film. She also learned how to cut and splice film stock using the editing machines and projectors of the time period.
Until 1939, Crawshay-Williams was a music critic. In 1942 he moved to Portmeirion, North Wales, where he taught English, French, and mathematics.
